intro: Rostellularia heterocarpoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that are typically borne in dense inflorescences. Its seeds are encased in hard, dry fruits that are adapted for dispersal by wind or animals. Rostellularia heterocarpoides is well-suited to harsh environments and is often found growing on sandy or rocky soils.
